intro: Ruehssia zimapanica, commonly known as the Zimapanica shrub, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
